moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6: my favourite defence to knight f3
moves.3. Bb5: wanting to keep my kings pawn i played d3
moves.6... h6: wanting to make the bishop retreat, i played this move
moves.8. dxe5 Nxe5: perhaps i should have played d3 e4,
moves.9. O-O: castling surprised me because i thought that he might take my knight on e4
moves.9... c6: releasing the pin on my bishop...
moves.10. Be2 Nxe4: i took this pawn to take his bishop on h4 while gaining a centre pawn
moves.11. Nxe4 Nxf3+: i played this move just to exchange pieces a little
moves.13. Nxd6+:
a good move which i seemed to have overlooked,
this now prevents me from castling
moves.13... Kf8 14. Nxb7:
again, a good move,
now i am behind on material and position
moves.14... Qc7 15. Nc5 Bf5 16. Re1 Qb6: i played this move in the hope of him moving his knight so i could fork his king and rook with my bishop
moves.17. Qd6+: forcing me to play king g8
moves.17... Kg8 18. Bxc6: threatening the rook on a8 while setting up re1-e8
moves.19. Qe5 Rxc6: i took the bishop because the next move i can take his knight
moves.20. Qxf5 g6:
stopping checkmate by re8 while keeping the threat on the knight because his queen has to 
retreat
moves.26... Rf6:
again threatening queen f2, letting him take my bishop, 
a plan was forming in my mind
moves.32... Qh3: at this point white resigned because there was no way of stopping mate

opening: Ruy Lopez (C62), old Steinitz defence, Nimzovich attack
